title: New Senate VA Committee Chairman to Focus on Veteran Suicide
summary: Sen. Jerry Moran lays out priorities for Senate Committee on Veterans' Affairs. The rising suicide rate among U.S. military veterans will be a top concern among members of the Senate Committee on Veterans' Affairs in the new year, the panel's incoming chairman said, with a focus on new legislation and added resources.

title: A Former Top Cop Makes a Daring Escape
summary: Iván Simonovis went from Caracas police chief to prisoner of Venezuela's socialist regime-then over a 60-foot cliff to freedom.. Miami

title: Barr's Loyalty Is to the Constitution, Not a Party
summary: The 'unitary executive' implies both a strong presidency and clear limits on presidential powers.. Washington's knives are out for Attorney General William Barr, and the stabbing has intensified since he delivered a November address at the Federalist Society. Predecessor Eric Holder-who while serving in the Obama administration described himself as "the president's wingman"-accused Mr. Barr of championing "essentially unbridled executive power." In the same Washington Post op-ed, Mr. Holder added that Mr. Barr's "nakedly partisan" remarks rendered him a pawn of President Trump and "unfit to lead the Justice Department"-an utterly unhinged claim.

title: Meet the Hong Kong Lawyers Working to Keep Protesters Free
summary: People yell out their names as they're being arrested so a bystander can call the volunteer legal-aid hotline.. Hong Kong

title: Clinton's Impeachment Was Dignified
summary: The Democratic base demanded a circus this time, and Pelosi is giving it to them.. There are always tensions between the House and the Senate, even when the same party controls both chambers. Each views the other, and its rules, procedures and attitudes, with some disdain. But the normal friction between the bodies has increased since the House began its effort to impeach President Trump.

title: Nancy Pelosi's Potemkin Impeachment
summary: The Speaker has built a grand facade to hide the historic weaknesses inside the Democratic Party.. By this point Christmas week, many readers have struggled to help children or grandchildren assemble impossible puzzles or intricate Lego contraptions. In this spirit, we invite you to puzzle through the pieces of Nancy Pelosi's impeachment project. Our list includes clues to the final picture.

title: 'Strictly Only Brothers' by SOB X RBE Review: A Snapshot of Bay Area Sounds
summary: The emerging California hip-hop group delivers an album that is energetic, but marked by an undercurrent of fatalism..

title: Buyers Return to Riskiest Junk Bonds
summary: Triple-C bonds have returned 4.7% in December after months of losses, as fund managers add risk to portfolios. Bonds with the lowest junk credit ratings have rallied in December, rebounding from a beating taken this fall, as fund managers prepare for 2020 by adding risk to their portfolios.

title: Stocks Are Climbing Faster Than Profits, but Investors Aren't Worried
summary: Periods where shares climb at a significantly faster rate than corporate earnings can lead to concerns about a bubble. Stock gains have lapped corporate profit growth during the roaring 2019 rally, but few portfolio managers are entering the new year concerned about investor exuberance.

title: Stocks Tick Lower Ahead of Christmas Holiday
summary: Trading volumes were thin; indexes are poised to close out their best year since 2013. U.S. stocks edged lower Tuesday, drifting slightly from their records, in a muted trading session ahead of the Christmas holiday.

title: How the Changing Face of Finance Is Affecting Management Accountants
summary: The head of the Institute of Management Accountants says the accounting profession is gaining value-added jobs. Management accountants-those corporate finance operators who help their companies manage costs and forecast cash flow-have a front-row seat to how technology is changing the businesses they help guide. Their own roles also are changing as data analytics and strategy management become increasingly integral.

title: Y.C. Fung, Chinese Immigrant, Pioneered Bioengineering Research
summary: UC San Diego professor brought an understanding of mechanics to the human body. Y.C. Fung might have spent his entire career as an aeronautical engineer if his mother hadn't suffered from glaucoma. Born in China, Mr. Fung had established himself as a professor at the California Institute of Technology and consultant on aircraft design.

title: Pentagon Considering a Troop Reduction in West Africa
summary: Defense officials seek a first step toward a Trump blueprint focusing on big-power rivalries, but the strategy has proven elusive. The Pentagon is considering a reduction in the number of U.S. troops in Western Africa as part of a long-term strategy of shifting the focus of forces, ships and air squadrons toward potential threats from Russia and China, defense officials said Tuesday.

title: Uber Co-Founder Kalanick Departs Board, Sells All His Shares
summary: Former CEO to step down from board at the end of the year. Travis Kalanick is parting ways with Uber Technologies Inc., the company he co-founded and turned into an icon of startup ambition before his tumultuous ouster as CEO in 2017.

title: Trump Offers Holiday Greetings in Video Call to U.S. Troops
summary: President praises soldiers, reminds them of pay raise they will be getting Jan. 1. WEST PALM BEACH, Fla.-President Trump called U.S. troops deployed around the world to offer holiday greetings on Christmas Eve, saying they were "tremendous warriors" who have "kept the Taliban running scared."

title: Italy Follows France in Levying a Digital Tax
summary: New tax threatens to deepen dispute with U.S. on how to tax big tech companies. Italy soon will join France in applying a new tax on large tech companies, a move that could deepen trans-Atlantic trade tensions and snarl up already-faltering negotiations over how best to tax companies such as Facebook Inc. and Google parent Alphabet Inc.

title: Bruce Willis Sells Bedford Corners Estate for $7.66 Million
summary: The 22-acre property is one of the priciest homes to sell in Westchester, N.Y., in 2019. Actor Bruce Willis and his wife Emma Heming Willis have sold their country estate near Bedford Corners, N.Y., for $7.66 million, or 41% off its original listing price.

title: Is a Santa Claus Rally Near?
summary: A look at how stocks generally fare between Christmas and right after New Year's. Investors are going to have to wait at least another day to find out if there is a Santa Claus rally.

title: Booker T. Jones Financed Music Lessons With a Paper Route
summary: The Grammy-winning musician discusses his childhood in Memphis, cutting class for his first recording session and an impromptu performance at a local barbershop. Booker T. Jones, 75, is a Grammy-winning songwriter, producer and arranger, and former leader of Booker T. & the MGs. He is the author of "Time Is Tight: My Life, Note by Note" (Little, Brown). He spoke with Marc Myers.

title: A Record Number of Homes Closed for $100 Million-Plus This Year
summary: Six deals topped $100 million in 2019, despite a general slowdown across the U.S. luxury real-estate market. Here is a look at the top-10 home sales. In 2019, a small group of enormous real estate deals, while bearing little relationship to the overall market, had an outsize impact on the national conversation about wealth inequality and the rapidly expanding billionaire class.

title: Canada's Shrinking Middle Class Has Its Own Minister
summary: Trudeau government has created a brief and a new tax law aimed at easing load on mid-range earners. OTTAWA-Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau is fond of rolling out his policies through the prism of what they mean for the middle class.

title: Emirates, Facing Headwinds, Says Leader Will Retire Next Year
summary: Tim Clark's anticipated departure comes as the airline contends with regional tensions and other challenges. Emirates Airline said its longtime chief plans to step down next year, an anticipated leadership change that comes amid a strategic rethink and at a time of headwinds in its key Middle East market.

title: In a Big Shift, Russians Take to the Streets Over Everyday Complaints
summary: Resume Subscription. St. PETERSBURG, Russia-Russians are protesting over everything from garbage disposal to hospital closures, voicing grievances about deteriorating public services as President Vladimir Putin tries to manage an economy beset by falling oil prices and international sanctions.

title: Football's Most Important Bowl Game Is on a Computer
summary: Eleven people were hired after last year's Big Data Bowl. This year, there were 32,000 submissions. The data geeks are storming football now.. Michael Lopez was stunned as he looked at this year's entries for the NFL's second annual Big Data Bowl. A year ago, only 125 people had participated in the inaugural competition where data geeks parse through mountains of information and try to discover new insights about the game.

title: On Christmas Eve in Hong Kong, Protests Are Still Going Strong
summary: Hundreds gather ahead of holiday as monthslong antigovernment demonstrations show no signs of easing. HONG KONG-The night before Christmas was marked with tear gas and rubber bullets as police tried to disperse protesters gathered near the city's harbor front, signaling a renewed escalation in the conflict after a few weeks of relative calm.

title: Fed Adds $24.8 Billion in Liquidity to Markets
summary: Eligible banks took far less liquidity than the $120 billion the Fed was willing to offer. The Federal Reserve Bank of New York added $24.8 billion in temporary liquidity to financial markets Tuesday.

summary: Canadians shopping via desktops are officially world's most reliable online shoppers, e-commerce firm finds. Canadians are reputed to be a polite people. Now there is hard evidence.

title: Do You Pay Too Much for Internet Service? See How Your Bill Compares.
summary: A WSJ analysis of thousands of U.S. broadband bills finds that low-income and rural areas often get worse deals than their counterparts.. Americans in low-income neighborhoods and rural areas get slower broadband speeds even though they generally pay similar monthly prices as their counterparts in wealthy and urban areas.

title: Methodology for the WSJ's Study of Broadband Bills
summary: Analysis looked at nearly 2,700 internet bills, largely from Charter, Comcast, AT&T and Verizon. The Wall Street Journal examined information from more than 3,300 bills for its study of broadband pricing across the U.S. We excluded more than 600 bills that didn't specify an internet price and used 2,694 bills for our analysis.

summary: Words of wisdom by authors from Melinda Gates to Marcus Aurelius. title: Saudi Arabia and Kuwait End Dispute Over Shared Oil Fields
summary: The agreement brings to an end a spat over a region that can produce about 500,000 barrels of crude oil a day. Saudi Arabia and Kuwait ended a five-year dispute over oil fields in a territory shared between the two countries, the latest sign of detente between Riyadh and its Persian Gulf neighbors.

title: Hilton to Launch New Brand Aimed at Young Professionals
summary: Hotel chain targets more affluent travelers with bigger rooms and plusher amenities. title: Learning From Mistakes Is Hard, 2019 Edition
summary: A look back at what Streetwise got wrong-and occasionally right-this year. Self-flagellation is no fun, but investors should make the effort to learn from their mistakes. The quiet end to the year provides a good time to think about what they got wrong, and how to avoid a repeat.

title: Home-Builder Rally Fueled by Low Interest Rates, Millennials
summary: Expectations for 2020 tempered after housing starts climb to levels not seen in a decade. U.S. home builders benefited from low interest rates this year as housing starts climbed to levels not seen in a decade and new-home sales surged after a disappointing 2018.

title: How the Justice Department Incentivizes Companies to Invest in Compliance

title: Retailers, Delivery Companies Stress Over Last-Minute Shoppers
